EN.text: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.
EN.author: Franklin Roosevelt

EN.text: Always be mindful of the kindness and not the faults of others.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: When fate hands us a lemon, lets try to make lemonade.
EN.author: Dale Carnegie

EN.text: The weak can never forgive. Forgiveness is the attribute of the strong.
EN.author: Mohandas Gandhi

EN.text: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
EN.author: Chanakya

EN.text: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
EN.author: Dale Carnegie

EN.text: Truth isn't all about what actually happens but more about how what has happened is interpreted.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: A good rest is half the work.
Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap but by the seeds that you plant.
EN.author: Robert Stevenson

EN.text: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
EN.author: Demosthenes

EN.text: To be tested is good. The challenged life may be the best therapist.
EN.author: Gail Sheehy

EN.text: Take heed: you do not find what you do not seek.
EN.author: English proverb

EN.text: Happiness is the reward we get for living to the highest right we know.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Be slow of tongue and quick of eye.
EN.author: Cervantes

EN.text: Freedom is not worth having if it does not connote freedom to err.
EN.author: Mohandas Gandhi

EN.text: I have always thought the actions of men the best interpreters of their thoughts.
EN.author: John Locke

EN.text: He who obtains has little. He who scatters has much.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: To dare is to lose ones footing momentarily. To not dare is to lose oneself.
EN.author: Soren Kierkegaard

EN.text: No day in which you learn something is a complete loss.
EN.author: David Eddings

EN.text: Peace cannot be kept by force. It can only be achieved by understanding.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: Real success is finding your lifework in the work that you love.
EN.author: David McCullough

EN.text: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: All the flowers of all the tomorrows are in the seeds of today.
Your sacred space is where you can find yourself again and again.
EN.author: Joseph Campbell

EN.text: As you think, so shall you become.
EN.author: Bruce Lee

EN.text: In seed time learn, in harvest teach, in winter enjoy.
EN.author: William Blake

EN.text: Happiness does not come from having much, but from being attached to little.
EN.author: Cheng Yen

EN.text: Every gift from a friend is a wish for your happiness.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Go put your creed into the deed. Nor speak with double tongue.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: The wisest men follow their own direction.
EN.author: Euripides

EN.text: Hope arouses, as nothing else can arouse, a passion for the possible.
EN.author: William Sloane Coffin

EN.text: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: Nothing ever goes away until it has taught us what we need to know.
EN.author: Pema Chodron

EN.text: When you learn, teach. When you get, give.
EN.author: Maya Angelou

EN.text: Only when we are no longer afraid do we begin to live.
EN.author: Dorothy Thompson

EN.text: If you smile when no one else is around, you really mean it.
EN.author: Andy Rooney

EN.text: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into friend.
EN.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

EN.text: In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: A man is not where he lives but where he loves.
The price of greatness is responsibility.
EN.author: Winston Churchill

EN.text: Decision is a risk rooted in the courage of being free.
EN.author: Paul Tillich

EN.text: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
EN.author: William Burroughs

EN.text: The world does not happen to you it happens from you.
We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: More powerful than the will to win is the courage to begin.
Learning is finding out what you already know.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Saying thank you is more than good manners. It is good spirituality.
EN.author: Alfred Painter

EN.text: Silence is a source of great strength.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: Joy is the best makeup.
EN.author: Anne Lamott

EN.text: There is no great genius without some touch of madness.
EN.author: Seneca

EN.text: A jug fills drop by drop.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
EN.author: Doris Mortman

EN.text: We aim above the mark to hit the mark.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: Being angry never solves anything.
EN.author: Catherine Pulsifer

EN.text: All men who have achieved great things have been great dreamers.
EN.author: Orison Marden

EN.text: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
EN.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

EN.text: Where all think alike, no one thinks very much.
EN.author: Walter Lippmann

EN.text: Everything that exists is in a manner the seed of that which will be.
EN.author: Marcus Aurelius

EN.text: Be less curious about people and more curious about ideas.
EN.author: Marie Curie

EN.text: The heart has eyes which the brain knows nothing of.
EN.author: Charles Perkhurst

EN.text: Only those who dare to fail greatly can ever achieve greatly.
EN.author: Robert Kennedy

EN.text: Lose an hour in the morning, and you will spend all day looking for it.
EN.author: Richard Whately

EN.text: Mistakes are always forgivable, if one has the courage to admit them.
EN.author: Bruce Lee

EN.text: Go to your bosom: Knock there, and ask your heart what it doth know.
EN.author: William Shakespeare

EN.text: Happiness mainly comes from our own attitude, rather than from external factors.
EN.author: Dalai Lama

EN.text: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: What we see is mainly what we look for.
Stay away from what might have been and look at what will be.
EN.author: Marsha Petrie Sue

EN.text: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
EN.author: William James

EN.text: Passion creates the desire for more and action fuelled by passion creates a future.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
EN.author: Alexander Pope

EN.text: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.
EN.author: Napoleon Hill

EN.text: Don't talk about what you have done or what you are going to do.
EN.author: Thomas Jefferson

EN.text: Most powerful is he who has himself in his own power.
EN.author: Seneca

EN.text: We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
EN.author: Bernard Shaw

EN.text: Experience can only be gained by doing not by thinking or dreaming.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: Always tell the truth. That way, you don't have to remember what you said.
EN.author: Mark Twain

EN.text: From wonder into wonder existence opens.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: He who fears being conquered is sure of defeat.
EN.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

EN.text: Life is what happens while you are making other plans.
EN.author: John Lennon

EN.text: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
EN.author: Wayne Dyer

EN.text: Kindness is the golden chain by which society is bound together.
EN.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

EN.text: You need chaos in your soul to give birth to a dancing star.
EN.author: Nietzsche

EN.text: It can't be spring if your heart is filled with past failures.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: No yesterdays are ever wasted for those who give themselves to today.
EN.author: Brendan Francis

EN.text: There are no failures just experiences and your reactions to them.
EN.author: Tom Krause

EN.text: Action is the foundational key to all success.
EN.author: Pablo Picasso

EN.text: What is necessary to change a person is to change his awareness of himself.
EN.author: Abraham Maslow

EN.text: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking about something else.
EN.author: Holmes

EN.text: First comes thought; then organization of that thought, into ideas and plans; then transformation of those plans into reality. The beginning, as you will observe, is in your imagination.
EN.author: Napoleon Hill

EN.text: The superior man acts before he speaks, and afterwards speaks according to his action.
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: A single conversation across the table with a wise person is worth a months study of books.
EN.author: Chinese proverb

EN.text: The difference between what we do and what we are capable of doing would suffice to solve most of the worlds problems.
EN.author: Mohandas Gandhi

EN.text: You can never cross the ocean unless you have the courage to lose sight of the shore.
Work for something because it is good, not just because it stands a chance to succeed.
EN.author: Vaclav Havel

EN.text: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: Make it a rule of life never to regret and never to look back. Regret is an appalling waste of energy; you can't build on it; it's only for wallowing in.
EN.author: Katherine Mansfield

EN.text: Never regret. If it's good, it's wonderful. If it's bad, it's experience.
EN.author: Victoria Holt

EN.text: When deeds and words are in accord, the whole world is transformed.
EN.author: Chuang Tzu

EN.text: Kind words can be short and easy to speak but their echoes are truly endless.
EN.author: Mother Teresa

EN.text: For everything that lives is holy, life delights in life.
EN.author: William Blake

EN.text: The most important thing is transforming our minds, for a new way of thinking, a new outlook: we should strive to develop a new inner world.
EN.author: Dalai Lama

EN.text: Our passion is our strength.
EN.author: Billie Armstrong

EN.text: In rivers, the water that you touch is the last of what has passed and the first of that which comes; so with present time.
EN.author: Leonardo da Vinci

EN.text: Spring is a time for rebirth and the fulfilment of new life.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: There is nothing happens to any person but what was in his power to go through with.
EN.author: Marcus Aurelius

EN.text: There are two ways to slide easily through life: to believe everything or to doubt everything; both ways save us from thinking.
EN.author: Alfred Korzybski

EN.text: The art of progress is to preserve order amid change, and to preserve change amid order.
EN.author: Alfred Whitehead

EN.text: We make a living by what we get, but we make a life by what we give.
EN.author: Winston Churchill

EN.text: If you want to study yourself look into the hearts of other people. If you want to study other people look into your own heart.
EN.author: Friedrich von Schiller

EN.text: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
EN.author: Wayne Dyer

EN.text: The first duty of a human being is to assume the right functional relationship to society more briefly, to find your real job, and do it.
EN.author: Charlotte Perkins Gilman

EN.text: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: Thought is the blossom; language the bud; action the fruit behind it.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: True happiness means forging a strong spirit that is undefeated, no matter how trying our circumstances.
EN.author: Daisaku Ikeda

EN.text: There is nothing so useless as doing efficiently that which should not be done at all.
EN.author: Peter Drucker

EN.text: I have been impressed with the urgency of doing. Knowing is not enough; we must apply. Being willing is not enough; we must do.
EN.author: Leonardo da Vinci

EN.text: All the world is a stage, And all the men and women merely players.They have their exits and entrances; Each man in his time plays many parts.
EN.author: William Shakespeare

EN.text: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.
EN.author: Nelson Mandela

EN.text: The most successful people are those who are good at plan B.
EN.author: James Yorke

EN.text: Criticism is something you can easily avoid by saying nothing, doing nothing, and being nothing.
EN.author: Aristotle

EN.text: To fly as fast as thought, you must begin by knowing that you have already arrived.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Obstacles are those things you see when you take your eyes off the goal.
EN.author: Hannah More

EN.text: The greatest danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high and we miss it, but that it is too low and we reach it.
EN.author: Michelangelo

EN.text: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
EN.author: Tony Robbins

EN.text: You are the only person on earth who can use your ability.
EN.author: Zig Ziglar

EN.text: Neither genius, fame, nor love show the greatness of the soul. Only kindness can do that.
EN.author: Jean Lacordaire

EN.text: The least of things with a meaning is worth more in life than the greatest of things without it.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: The noblest worship is to make yourself as good and as just as you can.
EN.author: Isocrates

EN.text: Though no one can go back and make a brand new start, anyone can start from not and make a brand new ending.
EN.author: Carl Bard

EN.text: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.
EN.author: Denis Waitley

EN.text: Don't think of it as failure. Think of it as time-released success.
EN.author: Robert Orben

EN.text: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit.
EN.author: Aristotle

EN.text: I walk slowly, but I never walk backward.
EN.author: Abraham Lincoln

EN.text: Divide each difficulty into as many parts as is feasible and necessary to resolve it.
EN.author: Rene Descartes

EN.text: The best place to find a helping hand is at the end of your own arm.
We know the truth, not only by the reason, but by the heart.
EN.author: Blaise Pascal

EN.text: We choose our joys and sorrows long before we experience them.
EN.author: Kahlil Gibran

EN.text: Anybody can make history. Only a great man can write it.
EN.author: Oscar Wilde

EN.text: If I know what love is, it is because of you.
EN.author: Hermann Hesse

EN.text: Allow the world to live as it chooses, and allow yourself to live as you choose.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Focusing your life solely on making a buck shows a poverty of ambition. It asks too little of yourself. And it will leave you unfulfilled.
EN.author: Barack Obama

EN.text: Compassion and happiness are not a sign of weakness but a sign of strength.
EN.author: Dalai Lama

EN.text: It is common sense to take a method and try it. If it fails, admit it frankly and try another. But above all, try something.
EN.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

EN.text: Be here now. Be someplace else later. Is that so complicated?
EN.author: David Bader

EN.text: To be able to give away riches is mandatory if you wish to possess them. This is the only way that you will be truly rich.
EN.author: Mahummad Ali

EN.text: Learning without reflection is a waste, reflection without learning is dangerous.
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: Don't fear failure so much that you refuse to try new things. The saddest summary of life contains three descriptions: could have, might have, and should have.
All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
EN.author: Bruce Lee

EN.text: I don't believe in failure. It's not failure if you enjoyed the process.
EN.author: Oprah Winfrey

EN.text: The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen, nor touched... but are felt in the heart.
EN.author: Helen Keller

EN.text: Success in business requires training and discipline and hard work. But if you're not frightened by these things, the opportunities are just as great today as they ever were.
EN.author: David Rockefeller

EN.text: The man who trusts men will make fewer mistakes than he who distrusts them.
EN.author: Cavour

EN.text: The less effort, the faster and more powerful you will be.
EN.author: Bruce Lee

EN.text: We must be as courteous to a man as we are to a picture, which we are willing to give the advantage of a good light.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: The dream was always running ahead of me. To catch up, to live for a moment in unison with it, that was the miracle.
EN.author: Anais Nin

EN.text: The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity.
EN.author: Ellen Parr

EN.text: We can do no great things, only small things with great love.
EN.author: Mother Teresa

EN.text: Be like the flower, turn your face to the sun.
EN.author: Kahlil Gibran

EN.text: Remembering a wrong is like carrying a burden on the mind.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance; the wise grows it under his feet.
EN.author: James Openheim

EN.text: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
EN.author: Henry Beecher

EN.text: If you look into your own heart, and you find nothing wrong there, what is there to worry about? What is there to fear?
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: You cannot have what you do not want.
EN.author: John Acosta

EN.text: Do not follow where the path may lead. Go, instead, where there is no path and leave a trail.
EN.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

EN.text: It is not fair to ask of others what you are unwilling to do yourself.
EN.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

EN.text: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: The best thing in every noble dream is the dreamer...
EN.author: Moncure Conway

EN.text: Weve got to have a dream if we are going to make a dream come true.
EN.author: Walt Disney

EN.text: If you want things to be different, perhaps the answer is to become different yourself.
EN.author: Norman Peale

EN.text: There is nothing impossible to him who will try.
EN.author: Alexander the Great

EN.text: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
EN.author: Theodore Rubin

EN.text: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
EN.author: Harriet Tubman

EN.text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: Anyone who doesn't take truth seriously in small matters cannot be trusted in large ones either.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: Change will not come if we wait for some other person or some other time. We are the ones weve been waiting for. We are the change that we seek.
EN.author: Barack Obama

EN.text: Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
EN.author: George Santayan

EN.text: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
EN.author: Carlos Castaneda

EN.text: Just as a flower, which seems beautiful has color but no perfume, so are the fruitless words of a man who speaks them but does them not.
EN.author: Dhammapada

EN.text: Things that were hard to bear are sweet to remember.
EN.author: Seneca

EN.text: Three things in human life are important. The first is to be kind. The second is to be kind. The third is to be kind.
EN.author: Henry James

EN.text: However many holy words you read, However many you speak, What good will they do you If you do not act on upon them?
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: They can conquer who believe they can.
EN.author: Virgil

EN.text: Learn to listen. Opportunity could be knocking at your door very softly.
EN.author: Frank Tyger

EN.text: All action results from thought, so it is thoughts that matter.
EN.author: Sai Baba

EN.text: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: I love my past. I love my present. I'm not ashamed of what Ive had, and I'm not sad because I have it no longer.
EN.author: Colette

EN.text: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
EN.author: Maya Angelou

EN.text: Just as much as we see in others we have in ourselves.
EN.author: William Hazlitt

EN.text: Prosperity depends more on wanting what you have than having what you want.
EN.author: Geoffrey F. Abert

EN.text: How many cares one loses when one decides not to be something but to be someone.
EN.author: Coco Chanel

EN.text: He who knows, does not speak. He who speaks, does not know.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: We cannot direct the wind but we can adjust the sails.
One may say the eternal mystery of the world is its comprehensibility.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: The self is not something ready-made, but something in continuous formation through choice of action.
EN.author: John Dewey

EN.text: Our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world as being able to remake ourselves.
EN.author: Mahatma Gandhi

EN.text: Moments of complete apathy are the best for new creations.
EN.author: Philip Breedveld

EN.text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
EN.author: John Powell

EN.text: To dream of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
EN.author: Tim Menchen

EN.text: The important thing is this: to be able at any moment to sacrifice what we are for what we could become.
EN.author: Charles Dubois

EN.text: Gratitude is not only the greatest of virtues, but the paren't of all the others.
EN.author: Cicero

EN.text: It is never too late. Even if you are going to die tomorrow, keep yourself straight and clear and be a happy human being today.
EN.author: Lama Yeshe

EN.text: Respect is not something that you can ask for, buy or borrow. Respect is what you earn from each person no matter their background or status.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: Things do not change; we change.
EN.author: Henry Thoreau

EN.text: We must learn our limits. We are all something, but none of us are everything.
EN.author: Blaise Pascal

EN.text: Learn wisdom from the ways of a seedling. A seedling which is never hardened off through stressful situations will never become a strong productive plant.
EN.author: Stephen Sigmund

EN.text: We are all faced with a series of great opportunities brilliantly disguised as impossible situations.
EN.author: Charles R. Swindoll

EN.text: All men have a sweetness in their life. That is what helps them go on. It is towards that they turn when they feel too worn out.
EN.author: Albert Camus

EN.text: Be a good listener. Your ears will never get you in trouble.
EN.author: Frank Tyger

EN.text: Meditation brings wisdom; lack of mediation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what hold you back, and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: You learn to speak by speaking, to study by studying, to run by running, to work by working; in just the same way, you learn to love by loving.
EN.author: Anatole France

EN.text: To listen well is as powerful a means of communication and influence as to talk well.
EN.author: John Marshall

EN.text: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
EN.author: George Sand

EN.text: Live through feeling and you will live through love. For feeling is the language of the soul, and feeling is truth.
EN.author: Matt Zotti

EN.text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: Reason and free inquiry are the only effectual agents against error.
EN.author: Thomas Jefferson

EN.text: The best cure for the body is a quiet mind.
EN.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

EN.text: See the positive side, the potential, and make an effort.
EN.author: Dalai Lama

EN.text: By accepting yourself and being fully what you are, your presence can make others happy.
EN.author: Jane Roberts

EN.text: Never deny a diagnosis, but do deny the negative verdict that may go with it.
EN.author: Norman Cousins

EN.text: The really unhappy person is the one who leaves undone what they can do, and starts doing what they don't understand; no wonder they come to grief.
EN.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

EN.text: You cannot be lonely if you like the person you're alone with.
EN.author: Wayne Dyer

EN.text: I do not believe in a fate that falls on men however they act; but I do believe in a fate that falls on man unless they act.
EN.author: G. K. Chesterton

EN.text: If you propose to speak, always ask yourself, is it true, is it necessary, is it kind.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: Risk more than others think is safe. Care more than others think is wise. Dream more than others think is practical.Expect more than others think is possible.
EN.author: Cadet Maxim

EN.text: Failure will never overtake me if my determination to succeed is strong enough.
EN.author: Og Mandino

EN.text: Let go of your attachment to being right, and suddenly your mind is more open. You're able to benefit from the unique viewpoints of others, without being crippled by your own judgement.
EN.author: Ralph Marston

EN.text: Wrinkles should merely indicate where smiles have been.
EN.author: Mark Twain

EN.text: Your attitude, not your aptitude, will determine your altitude.
EN.author: Zig Ziglar

EN.text: Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love.
EN.author: Rumi

EN.text: I gave my life to become the person I am right now. Was it worth it?
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Give thanks for a little and you will find a lot.
EN.author: Hausa

EN.text: Your ability to learn faster than your competition is your only sustainable competitive advantage.
EN.author: Arie de Gues

EN.text: Forgiveness does not change the past, but it does enlarge the future.
EN.author: Paul Boese

EN.text: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs; the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
EN.author: Nikola Tesla

EN.text: Moral excellence comes about as a result of habit. We become just by doing just acts, temperate by doing temperate acts, brave by doing brave acts.
EN.author: Aristotle

EN.text: The deepest craving of human nature is the need to be appreciated.
EN.author: William James

EN.text: Love does not consist of gazing at each other, but in looking together in the same direction.
EN.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

EN.text: We have committed the Golden Rule to memory; let us now commit it to life.
EN.author: Edwin Markham

EN.text: It is with words as with sunbeams. The more they are condensed, the deeper they burn.
EN.author: Robert Southey

EN.text: When people are like each other they tend to like each other.
EN.author: Tony Robbins

EN.text: Sincerity is the way of Heaven. The attainment of sincerity is the way of men.
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: Be the change that you want to see in the world.
EN.author: Mohandas Gandhi

EN.text: The more you care, the stronger you can be.
EN.author: Jim Rohn

EN.text: Lots of people want to ride with you in the limo, but what you want is someone who will take the bus with you when the limo breaks down.
EN.author: Oprah Winfrey

EN.text: Just trust yourself, then you will know how to live.
EN.author: Goethe

EN.text: To be fully alive, fully human, and completely awake is to be continually thrown out of the nest.
EN.author: Pema Chodron

EN.text: If you don't design your own life plan, chances are you'll fall into someone else's plan. And guess what they have planned for you? Not much.
EN.author: Jim Rohn

EN.text: It all depends on how we look at things, and not how they are in themselves.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: Giving up doesn't always mean you are weak; sometimes it means that you are strong enough to let go.
To climb steep hills requires a slow pace at first.
EN.author: William Shakespeare

EN.text: An idea that is developed and put into action is more important than an idea that exists only as an idea.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: It is not the possession of truth, but the success which attends the seeking after it, that enriches the seeker and brings happiness to him.
EN.author: Max Planck

EN.text: Truth is generally the best vindication against slander.
EN.author: Abraham Lincoln

EN.text: To follow, without halt, one aim: There is the secret of success.
EN.author: Anna Pavlova

EN.text: And as we let our own light shine, we unconsciously give other people permission to do the same.
EN.author: Nelson Mandela

EN.text: What is a weed? A plant whose virtues have not yet been discovered.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; Unbelief, in denying them.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: Many people have gone further than they thought they could because someone else thought they could.
We read the world wrong and say that it deceives us.
EN.author: Rabindranath Tagore

EN.text: If only wed stop trying to be happy wed have a pretty good time.
EN.author: Edith Wharton

EN.text: You must do the things you think you cannot do.
EN.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

EN.text: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
EN.author: Oscar Wilde

EN.text: The mark of your ignorance is the depth of your belief in injustice and tragedy. What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the Master calls the butterfly.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: I am glad that I paid so little attention to good advice; had I abided by it I might have been saved from some of my most valuable mistakes.
EN.author: Edna Millay

EN.text: Most folks are as happy as they make up their minds to be.
EN.author: Abraham Lincoln

EN.text: Love is the master key that opens the gates of happiness.
EN.author: Oliver Holmes

EN.text: The person who makes a success of living is the one who see his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
EN.author: Cecil B. DeMille

EN.text: My reputation grows with every failure.
EN.author: George Shaw

EN.text: Good thoughts are no better than good dreams, unless they be executed.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: Happiness does not come about only due to external circumstances; it mainly derives from inner attitudes.
EN.author: Dalai Lama

EN.text: However many holy words you read, however many you speak, what good will they do you if you do not act on upon them?
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
EN.author: Harry Banks

EN.text: If you are going to achieve excellence in big things, you develop the habit in little matters. Excellence is not an exception, it is a prevailing attitude.
EN.author: Colin Powell

EN.text: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: Better than a thousand hollow words is one word that brings peace.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: The possibilities are numerous once we decide to act and not react.
EN.author: George Bernard Shaw

EN.text: Almost everything comes from nothing.
EN.author: Henri Amiel

EN.text: Sometimes by losing a battle you find a new way to win the war.
EN.author: Donald Trump

EN.text: Listen to what you know instead of what you fear.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: It is easier to live through someone else than to become complete yourself.
EN.author: Betty Friedan

EN.text: If you're in a bad situation, don't worry it'll change. If you're in a good situation, don't worry it'll change.
EN.author: John Simone

EN.text: Remember that failure is an event, not a person.
EN.author: Zig Ziglar

EN.text: Don't settle for a relationship that won't let you be yourself.
EN.author: Oprah Winfrey

EN.text: What the caterpillar calls the end of the world, the master calls a butterfly.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Instead of saying that man is the creature of circumstance, it would be nearer the mark to say that man is the architect of circumstance.
EN.author: Thomas Carlyle

EN.text: If you do what you've always done, you'll get what youve always gotten.
EN.author: Tony Robbins

EN.text: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
EN.author: Mother Teresa

EN.text: Knowledge has three degrees opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition.
EN.author: Plotinus

EN.text: Love vanquishes time. To lovers, a moment can be eternity, eternity can be the tick of a clock.
EN.author: Mary Parrish

EN.text: We never live; we are always in the expectation of living.
EN.author: Voltaire

EN.text: Think like a man of action; act like a man of thought.
EN.author: Henri L. Bergson

EN.text: You can complain because roses have thorns, or you can rejoice because thorns have roses.
EN.author: Ziggy

EN.text: There is not one big cosmic meaning for all, there is only the meaning we each give to our life.
EN.author: Anais Nin

EN.text: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: Time you enjoyed wasting was not wasted.
EN.author: John Lennon

EN.text: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
EN.author: Albert Camus

EN.text: Genuine sincerity opens people's hearts, while manipulation causes them to close.
EN.author: Daisaku Ikeda

EN.text: To give ones self earnestly to the duties due to men, and, while respecting spiritual beings, to keep aloof from them, may be called wisdom.
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: A man's dreams are an index to his greatness.
EN.author: Zadok Rabinowitz

EN.text: This is the final test of a gentleman: his respect for those who can be of no possible value to him.
EN.author: William Lyon Phelps

EN.text: You teach best what you most need to learn.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Continuous effort, not strength or intelligence is the key to unlocking our potential.
EN.author: Winston Churchill

EN.text: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
EN.author: Henry Ford

EN.text: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
EN.author: Wayne Dyer

EN.text: Never tell a young person that anything cannot be done. God may have been waiting centuries for someone ignorant enough of the impossible to do that very thing.
EN.author: John Holmes

EN.text: Bold is not the act of foolishness but the attribute and inner strength to act when others will not so as to move forward not backward.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: If we look at the world with a love of life, the world will reveal its beauty to us.
EN.author: Daisaku Ikeda

EN.text: In skating over thin ice our safety is in our speed.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: When you discover your mission, you will feel its demand. It will fill you with enthusiasm and a burning desire to get to work on it.
EN.author: W. Clement Stone

EN.text: Never promise more than you can perform.
EN.author: Publilius Syrus

EN.text: If you don't go after what you want, you'll never have it. If you don't ask, the answer is always no. If you don't step forward, you're always in the same place.
EN.author: Nora Roberts

EN.text: I can't believe that God put us on this earth to be ordinary.
EN.author: Lou Holtz

EN.text: There are no limitations to the mind except those we acknowledge.
EN.author: Napoleon Hill

EN.text: It is through science that we prove, but through intuition that we discover.
EN.author: Jules Poincare

EN.text: Don't be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: If someone in your life talked to you the way you talk to yourself, you would have left them long ago.
EN.author: Carla Gordon

EN.text: The cosmos is neither moral or immoral; only people are. He who would move the world must first move himself.
EN.author: Edward Ericson

EN.text: If you lose today, win tomorrow. In this never-ending spirit of challenge is the heart of a victor.
EN.author: Daisaku Ikeda

EN.text: There is a way that nature speaks, that land speaks. Most of the time we are simply not patient enough, quiet enough, to pay attention to the story.
EN.author: Linda Hogan

EN.text: Never tell me the sky is the limit when there are footprints on the moon.
I cannot say whether things will get better if we change; what I can say is they must change if they are to get better.
EN.author: Georg Lichtenberg

EN.text: The greater part of human pain is unnecessary. It is self-created as long as the unobserved mind runs your life.
EN.author: Eckhart Tolle

EN.text: Take it easy but take it.
EN.author: Woody Guthrie

EN.text: Blessed is the man who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed.
EN.author: Alexander Pope

EN.text: He who knows others is wise. He who knows himself is enlightened.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: The best way to predict your future is to create it.
EN.author: Peter Drucker

EN.text: A garden is always a series of losses set against a few triumphs, like life itself.
EN.author: May Sarton

EN.text: If facts are the seeds that later produce knowledge and wisdom, then the emotions and the impressions of the senses are the fertile soil in which the seeds must grow.
EN.author: Rachel Carson

EN.text: Never mistake motion for action.
EN.author: Ernest Hemingway

EN.text: One needs something to believe in, something for which one can have whole-hearted enthusiasm. One needs to feel that ones life has meaning, that one is needed in this world.
EN.author: Hannah Senesh

EN.text: One who is too insistent on his own views, finds few to agree with him.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: Translation is the paradigm, the exemplar of all writing. It is translation that demonstrates most vividly the yearning for transformation that underlies every act involving speech, that supremely human gift.
EN.author: Harry Burchell Mathews

EN.text: Meditation is the dissolution of thoughts in eternal awareness or Pure consciousness without objectification, knowing without thinking, merging finitude in infinity.
EN.author: Voltaire

EN.text: The reasonable man adapts himself to the world; the unreasonable man persists in trying to adapt the world to himself. Therefore, all progress depends on the unreasonable man.
EN.author: George Shaw

EN.text: Good instincts usually tell you what to do long before your head has figured it out.
EN.author: Michael Burke

EN.text: It isn't what happens to us that causes us to suffer; it's what we say to ourselves about what happens.
EN.author: Pema Chodron

EN.text: Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night.
EN.author: Edgar Allan Poe

EN.text: We cannot hold a torch to light another's path without brightening our own.
EN.author: Ben Sweetland

EN.text: You are never given a wish without also being given the power to make it come true. You may have to work for it, however.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: Kind words can be short and easy to speak, but their echoes are truly endless.
EN.author: Mother Teresa

EN.text: Count your joys instead of your woes. Count your friends instead of your foes.
Dreams come true. Without that possibility, nature would not incite us to have them.
EN.author: John Updike

EN.text: Staying in one place is the best path to be taken over and surpassed by many.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: Imagination will often carry us to worlds that never were. But without it we go nowhere.
EN.author: Carl Sagan

EN.text: When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us.
EN.author: Helen Keller

EN.text: A leader or a man of action in a crisis almost always acts subconsciously and then thinks of the reasons for his action.
EN.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

EN.text: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
EN.author: Albert Einstein

EN.text: I endeavour to be wise when I cannot be merry, easy when I cannot be glad, content with what cannot be mended and patient when there is no redress.
EN.author: Elizabeth Montagu

EN.text: The height of your accomplishments will equal the depth of your convictions.
EN.author: William Scolavino

EN.text: If I am not for myself, who will be for me? If I am not for others, what am I? And if not now, when?
EN.author: Rabbi Hillel

EN.text: When I dare to be powerful, to use my strength in the service of my vision, then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid.
EN.author: Audre Lorde

EN.text: All great men are gifted with intuition. They know without reasoning or analysis, what they need to know.
EN.author: Alexis Carrel

EN.text: To get the full value of joy you must have someone to divide it with.
EN.author: Mark Twain

EN.text: Sometimes our fate resembles a fruit tree in winter. Who would think that those branches would turn green again and blossom, but we hope it, we know it.
EN.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

EN.text: We lost because we told ourselves we lost.
EN.author: Leo Tolstoy

EN.text: Success is determined by those whom prove the impossible, possible.
EN.author: James Pence

EN.text: Good advice is always certain to be ignored, but that's no reason not to give it.
EN.author: Agatha Christie

EN.text: The winner ain't the one with the fastest car it's the one who refuses to lose.
EN.author: Dale Earnhardt

EN.text: Spirituality can be severed from both vicious sectarianism and thoughtless banalities. Spirituality, I have come to see, is nothing less than the thoughtful love of life.
EN.author: Robert C. Solomon

EN.text: No one has a finer command of language than the person who keeps his mouth shut.
EN.author: Sam Rayburn

EN.text: The only person who never makes mistakes is the person who never does anything.
EN.author: Denis Waitley

EN.text: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
EN.author: John Lennon

EN.text: Discovery consists of seeing what everybody has seen and thinking what nobody else has thought.
EN.author: Jonathan Swift

EN.text: If you have knowledge, let others light their candles in it.
EN.author: Margaret Fuller

EN.text: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
EN.author: Epictetus

EN.text: If you find yourself in a hole, the first thing to do is stop digging.
EN.author: Will Rogers

EN.text: To make no mistakes is not in the power of man; but from their errors and mistakes the wise and good learn wisdom for the future.
EN.author: Plutarch

EN.text: I think you can have moderate success by copying something else, but if you really want to knock it out of the park, you have to do something different and take chances.
EN.author: Lee Womack

EN.text: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
EN.author: Marcus Aurelius

EN.text: Six essential qualities that are the key to success: Sincerity, personal integrity, humility, courtesy, wisdom, charity.
EN.author: William Menninger

EN.text: I have an everyday religion that works for me. Love yourself first, and everything else falls into line.
EN.author: Lucille Ball

EN.text: Flow with whatever is happening and let your mind be free. Stay centred by accepting whatever you are doing. This is the ultimate.
EN.author: Chuang Tzu

EN.text: Nothing could be worse than the fear that one had given up too soon, and left one unexpended effort that might have saved the world.
EN.author: Jane Addams

EN.text: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
EN.author: Aristotle

EN.text: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
EN.author: Horace

EN.text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
EN.author: Francis Bacon

EN.text: Slow down and enjoy life. It's not only the scenery you miss by going too fast you also miss the sense of where you are going and why.
EN.author: Eddie Cantor

EN.text: Miracles come in moments. Be ready and willing.
EN.author: Wayne Dyer

EN.text: Numberless are the worlds wonders, but none more wonderful than man.
EN.author: Sophocles

EN.text: So is cheerfulness, or a good temper, the more it is spent, the more remains.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: The true way to render ourselves happy is to love our work and find in it our pleasure.
EN.author: Francoise de Motteville

EN.text: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
EN.author: Wayne Dyer

EN.text: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
EN.author: Richard Bach

EN.text: He who wishes to secure the good of others, has already secured his own.
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
EN.author: Plato

EN.text: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
EN.author: Confucius

EN.text: The future is an opaque mirror. Anyone who tries to look into it sees nothing but the dim outlines of an old and worried face.
EN.author: Jim Bishop

EN.text: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to a better understanding of ourselves.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: Beware of the half truth. You may have gotten hold of the wrong half.
The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one.
EN.author: Elbert Hubbard

EN.text: I have never been hurt by anything I didn't say.
EN.author: Calvin Coolidge

EN.text: Be not angry that you cannot make others as you wish them to be, since you cannot make yourself as you wish to be.
EN.author: Thomas Kempis

EN.text: Adversity causes some men to break, others to break records.
EN.author: William Ward

EN.text: An invincible determination can accomplish almost anything and in this lies the great distinction between great men and little men.
EN.author: Thomas Fuller

EN.text: The industrial landscape is already littered with remains of once successful companies that could not adapt their strategic vision to altered conditions of competition.
EN.author: Abernathy

EN.text: Example has more followers than reason.
EN.author: Christian Bovee

EN.text: One that desires to excel should endeavour in those things that are in themselves most excellent.
EN.author: Epictetus

EN.text: If you have made mistakes, there is always another chance for you. You may have a fresh start any moment you choose.
EN.author: Mary Pickford

EN.text: The only Zen you find on the tops of mountains is the Zen you bring up there.
EN.author: Robert Pirsig

EN.text: Gratitude is riches. Complaint is poverty.
EN.author: Doris Day

EN.text: Strong people make as many mistakes as weak people. Difference is that strong people admit their mistakes, laugh at them, learn from them. That is how they become strong.
EN.author: Richard Needham

EN.text: To know your purpose is to live a life of direction, and in that direction is found peace and tranquillity.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims.
EN.author: Harriet Woods

EN.text: Bad times have a scientific value. These are occasions a good learner would not miss.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: It's not who you are that holds you back, it's who you think you're not.
All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
EN.author: Pablo Picasso

EN.text: Either I will find a way, or I will make one.
EN.author: Philip Sidney

EN.text: He who knows that enough is enough will always have enough.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
EN.author: Ralph Emerson

EN.text: If we had no winter, the spring would not be so pleasant; if we did not sometimes taste of adversity, prosperity would not be so welcome.
EN.author: Anne Bradstreet

EN.text: Joy is what happens to us when we allow ourselves to recognize how good things really are.
EN.author: Marianne Williamson

EN.text: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
EN.author: Carl Jung

EN.text: There is never enough time to do everything, but there is always enough time to do the most important thing.
EN.author: Brian Tracy

EN.text: You really can change the world if you care enough.
EN.author: Marian Edelman

EN.text: What you are is what you have been. What you will be is what you do now.
EN.author: Buddha

EN.text: Our lives are the only meaningful expression of what we believe and in Whom we believe. And the only real wealth, for any of us, lies in our faith.
EN.author: Gordon Hinckley

EN.text: There surely is in human nature an inherent propensity to extract all the good out of all the evil.
EN.author: Benjamin Haydon

EN.text: Music in the soul can be heard by the universe.
EN.author: Lao Tzu

EN.text: What we see depends mainly on what we look for.
EN.author: John Lubbock

EN.text: To hell with circumstances; I create opportunities.
EN.author: Bruce Lee

EN.text: The truest greatness lies in being kind, the truest wisdom in a happy mind.
EN.author: Ella Wilcox

EN.text: An ounce of emotion is equal to a ton of facts.
EN.author: John Junor

EN.text: We need to find the courage to say NO to the things and people that are not serving us if we want to rediscover ourselves and live our lives with authenticity.
EN.author: Barbara De Angelis

EN.text: Great is the art of beginning, but greater is the art of ending.
EN.author: Lazurus Long

EN.text: Simply put, you believer that things or people make you unhappy, but this is not accurate. You make yourself unhappy.
EN.author: Wayne Dyer

EN.text: Nothing will work unless you do.
EN.author: Maya Angelou

EN.text: Our ability to achieve happiness and success depends on the strength of our wings.
EN.author: Catherine Pulsifer

EN.text: To go against the dominant thinking of your friends, of most of the people you see every day, is perhaps the most difficult act of heroism you can perform.
EN.author: Theodore H. White

EN.text: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
EN.author: Melody Beattie

EN.text: Into each life rain must fall but rain can be the giver of life and it is all in your attitude that makes rain produce sunshine.
EN.author: Byron Pulsifer

EN.text: We are all inclined to judge ourselves by our ideals; others, by their acts.
EN.author: Harold Nicolson

EN.text: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
EN.author: Rodin

EN.text: If one way be better than another, that you may be sure is natures way.
EN.author: Aristotle

EN.text: Here is one quality that one must possess to win, and that is definiteness of purpose, the knowledge of what one wants, and a burning desire to possess it.
EN.author: Napoleon Hill

EN.text: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
EN.author: William Shakespeare

EN.text: Using the power of decision gives you the capacity to get past any excuse to change any and every part of your life in an instant.
EN.author: Tony Robbins

EN.text: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
EN.author: Abraham Lincoln

EN.text: Sometimes the cards we are dealt are not always fair. However you must keep smiling and moving on.
EN.author: Tom Jackson

RU.text: Гениальность - это один процент вдохновения и девяносто девять процентов пота.
RU.author: Томас Эдисон

RU.text: Вы можете многое наблюдать, просто наблюдая.
RU.author: Йоги Берра

RU.text: Дом, разделенный сам против себя, не может устоять.
RU.author: Авраам Линкольн

RU.text: Трудности возрастают по мере приближения к цели.
RU.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

RU.text: Судьба в твоих руках, и больше ни у кого
RU.author: Байрон Пульсифер

RU.text: Будь вождем, но никогда не будь господином.
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: Ничего не происходит, если сначала мы не помечтаем.
RU.author: Карл Сэндберг

RU.text: Хорошо начатое - это наполовину сделанное.
RU.author: Аристотель

RU.text: Жизнь - это опыт обучения, только если ты учишься.
RU.author: Йоги Берра

RU.text: Самодовольство губительно для прогресса.
RU.author: Маргарет Сангстер

RU.text: Покой приходит изнутри. Не ищи его вовне.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Что вы даете, то и получаете.
RU.author: Байрон Пульсифер

RU.text: Мы можем научиться любить, только любя.
RU.author: Айрис Мердок

RU.text: Жизнь - это перемены. Рост необязателен. Выбирайте с умом.
RU.author: Карен Кларк

RU.text: Ты увидишь это, когда поверишь в это.
RU.author: Уэйн Дайер

RU.text: Сегодня - это то завтра, о котором мы беспокоились вчера.
Легче увидеть ошибки на чужой бумаге.
Каждый человек умирает. Не каждый человек по-настоящему живет.
Чтобы вести людей, идите за ними.
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: Ничего не имея, он ничего не может потерять.
RU.author: Уильям Шекспир

RU.text: Проблема - это только возможность в рабочей одежде.
RU.author: Генри Дж. Кайзер

RU.text: Катящийся камень не собирает мха.
RU.author: Публилий Сирус

RU.text: Идеи - это отправная точка всех состояний.
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Все в жизни - это удача.
RU.author: Дональд Трамп

RU.text: Лучше ничего не делать, чем быть занятым ничегонеделанием.
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: Доверяй себе. Ты знаешь больше, чем думаешь.
RU.author: Бенджамин Спок

RU.text: Изучай прошлое, если хочешь предугадать будущее.
RU.author: Конфуций

RU.text: День уже благословен, обрети в нем покой.
От ошибки к ошибке человек открывает всю истину.
RU.author: Зигмунд Фрейд

RU.text: Хорошо сделанное лучше, чем хорошо сказанное.
RU.author: Бенджамин Франклин

RU.text: Откуси больше, чем сможешь прожевать, а затем прожуй это.
RU.author: Элла Уильямс

RU.text: Совершай свое собственное спасение. Не полагайся на других.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Один сегодняшний день стоит двух завтрашних.
RU.author: Бенджамин Франклин

RU.text: Как только ты выберешь надежду, все станет возможным.
RU.author: Кристофер Рив

RU.text: Бог всегда выбирает самый простой путь.
RU.author: Albert Einstein

RU.text: Человек терпит неудачу на пути к успеху.
RU.author: Чарльз Кеттеринг

RU.text: Из малых начинаний рождаются великие дела.
Обучение - это сокровище, которое будет следовать за своим владельцем повсюду
RU.author: Китайская пословица

RU.text: Будь таким, каким ты хочешь казаться.
RU.author: Сократ

RU.text: Мир всегда находится в движении.
RU.author: В. Найпол

RU.text: Никогда не путайте деятельность с достижением.
RU.author: Джон Вуден

RU.text: То, что тебя беспокоит, овладевает тобой.
RU.author: Хэддон Робинсон

RU.text: Человек смотрит в будущее вместе со своим прошлым.
RU.author: Перл Бак

RU.text: Цели - это топливо в печи достижения.
RU.author: Брайан Трейси

RU.text: Кто сеет добродетель, пожинает честь.
RU.author: Леонардо да Винчи

RU.text: Будьте добры, когда это возможно. Это всегда возможно.
RU.author: Далай-лама

RU.text: Разговоры не готовят рис.
RU.author: Китайская пословица

RU.text: Способен тот, кто думает, что способен.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Цель без плана - это просто желание.
RU.author: Ларри Элдер

RU.text: Чтобы добиться успеха, мы должны сначала поверить в то, что мы можем.
RU.author: Майкл Корда

RU.text: Учись на вчерашнем дне, живи сегодняшним днем, надейся на завтра.
RU.author: Albert Einstein

RU.text: Сорняк - это не более чем замаскированный цветок.
RU.author: Джеймс Лоуэлл

RU.text: Делай или не делай. Нет никакой попытки.
RU.author: Йода

RU.text: Всякая серьезная смелость начинается изнутри.
RU.author: Харриет Бичер-Стоу

RU.text: Лучший учитель - это опыт, извлеченный из неудач.
RU.author: Байрон Пульсифер

RU.text: Подумайте, насколько сложной была бы физика, если бы частицы могли мыслить.
RU.author: Мюррей Гелл-Манн

RU.text: Любовь - это цветок, которому нужно дать вырасти.
RU.author: Джон Леннон

RU.text: Не жди. Время никогда не будет подходящим.
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Время - самый мудрый советчик из всех.
RU.author: Перикл

RU.text: Ты отдаешь раньше, чем получаешь.
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Мудрость начинается с удивления.
RU.author: Сократ

RU.text: Без мужества мудрость не приносит плода.
RU.author: Бальтазар Грасиан

RU.text: Перемены во всем приятны.
RU.author: Аристотель

RU.text: То, чего ты боишься, - это то, что требует действий для преодоления.
RU.author: Байрон Пульсифер

RU.text: Когда производительность превышает амбиции, совпадение называется успехом.
RU.author: Каллен Хайтауэр

RU.text: Когда говорят дела, слова - ничто.
RU.author: Африканская пословица

RU.text: Настоящая магия в отношениях означает отсутствие осуждения других.
RU.author: Уэйн Дайер

RU.text: Я никогда не думаю о будущем. Это произойдет достаточно скоро.
RU.author: Albert Einstein

RU.text: Умение делать приходит от делания.
RU.author: Ральф Эмерсон

RU.text: Мудрость - это высшая составляющая счастья.
RU.author: Софокл

RU.text: Я верю, что каждый человек рождается с талантом.
RU.author: Майя Анжелу

RU.text: Важные принципы могут и должны быть негибкими.
RU.author: Авраам Линкольн

RU.text: Совершение нового действия приносит новые силы.
RU.author: Ричард Эванс

RU.text: Годы учат многому, чего никогда не узнают дни.
RU.author: Ральф Эмерсон

RU.text: Наше недоверие обходится очень дорого.
RU.author: Ральф Эмерсон

RU.text: Все знают путь; немногие действительно идут по нему.
RU.author: Бодхидхарма

RU.text: Великий талант находит счастье в исполнении.
RU.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

RU.text: Вера в себя - это самый лучший и безопасный путь.
RU.author: Микеланджело

RU.text: Мужество - это переход от неудачи к неудаче, не теряя энтузиазма.
RU.author: Уинстон Черчилль

RU.text: Два самых могущественных воина - это терпение и время.
RU.author: Лев Толстой

RU.text: Предвидите трудное, управляя легким.
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: Те, кто свободен от обид, несомненно, обретут покой.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Короткое высказывание часто содержит много мудрости.
RU.author: Софокл

RU.text: Для создания радуги нужны и солнечный свет, и дождь.
Красивая вещь никогда не бывает совершенной.
Делай только то, что подсказывает тебе твое сердце.
RU.author: Принцесса Диана

RU.text: Жизнь - это движение - мы дышим, мы едим, мы ходим, мы двигаемся!
RU.author: Джон Пьерракос

RU.text: Никто не может заставить вас чувствовать себя неполноценным без вашего согласия.
RU.author: Элеонора Рузвельт

RU.text: Аргументируйте свои ограничения, и, конечно же, они ваши.
RU.author: Ричард Бах

RU.text: Удача - это то, что случается, когда подготовка встречается с возможностью.
RU.author: Сенека

RU.text: Победа принадлежит самым настойчивым.
RU.author: Наполеон Бонапарт

RU.text: Люби всех, доверяй немногим, никому не делай зла.
RU.author: Уильям Шекспир

RU.text: Чтобы победить, вы должны ожидать победы.
RU.author: Ричард Бах

RU.text: Цель - это мечта с определенным сроком исполнения.
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Ты сможешь это сделать, если поверишь, что сможешь!
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Ставьте перед собой высокие цели и не останавливайтесь, пока не достигнете их.
RU.author: Бо Джексон

RU.text: Каждый новый день - это еще один шанс изменить свою жизнь.
Улыбнись, дыши и двигайся медленно.
RU.author: Тич Нат Хан

RU.text: Никто не поверит в тебя, если ты не поверишь в себя.
RU.author: Либераче

RU.text: Делай больше, чем мечтай: работай.
RU.author: Уильям Артур Уорд

RU.text: Ни один человек никогда не был мудр случайно.
RU.author: Сенека

RU.text: Одни стремятся к счастью, другие создают его.
Тот, у кого кружится голова, думает, что мир вращается.
RU.author: Уильям Шекспир

RU.text: Не разрушай настоящее разрушенным прошлым.
RU.author: Эллен Гилкрист

RU.text: Сделай что-нибудь замечательное, люди могут подражать этому.
RU.author: Albert Schweitzer

RU.text: Мы делаем то, что делаем, потому что верим.
Каждый день делай одну вещь, которая тебя пугает.
RU.author: Элеонора Рузвельт

RU.text: Если ты не можешь молчать, будь умным и вдумчивым.
RU.author: Байрон Пульсифер

RU.text: Кто смотрит наружу, видит сны; кто смотрит внутрь, просыпается.
RU.author: Карл Юнг

RU.text: Кем мы думаем, тем мы и становимся.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Самый короткий ответ - это делать.
RU.author: Лорд Герберт

RU.text: Все наши знания берут свое начало в нашем восприятии.
RU.author: Леонардо да Винчи

RU.text: Чем сильнее ты падаешь, тем выше подпрыгиваешь.
Доверие нашей интуиции часто спасает нас от беды.
RU.author: Энн Уилсон Шефф

RU.text: Истина могущественна, и она побеждает.
RU.author: Странник истины

RU.text: Зажги завтра сегодняшним днем!
RU.author: Элизабет Браунинг

RU.text: Молчание - это ограда вокруг мудрости.
RU.author: Немецкая пословица

RU.text: Общество развивает остроумие, но только его созерцание формирует гениальность.
RU.author: Мадам де Сталь

RU.text: Самые простые вещи часто оказываются самыми правдивыми.
RU.author: Ричард Бах

RU.text: Все улыбаются на одном языке.
Вчера я осмелился бороться. Сегодня я осмеливаюсь победить.
RU.author: Бернадетт Девлин

RU.text: Никакое алиби не спасет вас от принятия ответственности.
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Если ты можешь мечтать об этом, ты можешь это сделать.
RU.author: Уолт Дисней

RU.text: Лучше хорошо путешествовать, чем приезжать.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Жизнь сокращается или расширяется пропорционально мужеству человека.
RU.author: Анаис Нин

RU.text: Ты должен верить в себя.
RU.author: Сунь-цзы

RU.text: Наше намерение создает нашу реальность.
RU.author: Уэйн Дайер

RU.text: Молчание - настоящий друг, который никогда не предает.
RU.author: Конфуций

RU.text: Характер развивается сам по себе в потоке жизни.
RU.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

RU.text: Из маленьких желудей вырастают могучие дубы.
RU.author: Американская пословица

RU.text: Ты не можешь остановить волны, но ты можешь научиться серфингу.
RU.author: Джон Кабат-Зинн

RU.text: Реальность не соответствует идеалу, но подтверждает его.
RU.author: Гюстав Флобер

RU.text: Говори тише, если говоришь о любви.
RU.author: Уильям Шекспир

RU.text: По-настоящему великий талант находит свое счастье в исполнении.
RU.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

RU.text: Реальность оставляет многое для воображения.
RU.author: Джон Леннон

RU.text: Величайшее средство от гнева - это промедление.
RU.author: Сенека

RU.text: Рост сам по себе содержит в себе зародыш счастья.
RU.author: Перл Бак

RU.text: Вы можете делать то, что разумно, или вы можете решить, что возможно.
Ничто так не укрепляет власть, как молчание.
RU.author: Леонардо да Винчи

RU.text: Куда бы ты ни пошел, иди всем своим сердцем.
RU.author: Конфуций

RU.text: Единственная по-настоящему ценная вещь - это интуиция.
RU.author: Albert Einstein

RU.text: Удача - это другое название упорства в достижении цели.
RU.author: Ральф Эмерсон

RU.text: Радуги извиняются за разгневанные небеса.
RU.author: Сильвия Вуароль

RU.text: Дружба - это не такая уж большая вещь. Это миллион мелочей.
Время - это самое ценное, что может потратить человек.
RU.author: Теофраст

RU.text: Что бы ни случилось, возьми на себя ответственность.
RU.author: Тони Роббинс

RU.text: Опыт - это просто название, которое мы даем нашим ошибкам.
RU.author: Оскар Уайльд

RU.text: Я думаю, и это все, чем я являюсь.
RU.author: Уэйн Дайер

RU.text: Хороший план сегодня лучше, чем идеальный план завтра.
Если обувь не подходит, нужно ли менять ногу?
RU.author: Глория Стейнем

RU.text: Каждый день преподносит свои собственные дары.
RU.author: Марк Аврелий

RU.text: Когда мы останавливаемся, чтобы подумать, мы часто упускаем свою возможность.
RU.author: Публилий Сирус

RU.text: Жизнь - это не поиск себя. Жизнь - это создание самого себя.
RU.author: Бернард Шоу

RU.text: Чтобы привнести что-то в свою жизнь, представьте, что это уже есть.
RU.author: Ричард Бах

RU.text: Начинай ткать, и Бог даст тебе нить.
RU.author: Немецкая пословица

RU.text: Чем больше ты познаешь себя, тем больше ты прощаешь себя.
RU.author: Конфуций

RU.text: Кто-то помнит, кому-то не все равно; твое имя шепчут в чьих-то молитвах.
Без веры ничто не возможно. С ним нет ничего невозможного.
RU.author: Мэри Бетьюн

RU.text: Как только мы принимаем наши пределы, мы выходим за их пределы.
RU.author: Albert Einstein

RU.text: Не поддавайтесь на уговоры своих проблем, руководствуйтесь своими мечтами.
Все, чего мы ожидаем с уверенностью, становится нашим собственным самоисполняющимся пророчеством.
RU.author: Брайан Трейси

RU.text: Все, что вы можете себе представить, реально.
RU.author: Пабло Пикассо

RU.text: Страх - это темная комната, где накапливается негатив.
RU.author: Усман Асиф

RU.text: Самая истинная мудрость - это непоколебимая решимость.
RU.author: Наполеон Бонапарт

RU.text: Жизнь - это цветок, для которого любовь - мед.
RU.author: Виктор Гюго

RU.text: Свобода - это право жить так, как мы хотим.
RU.author: Эпиктет

RU.text: Измените свои мысли, измените свою жизнь!
Никогда не игнорируй внутреннее чувство, но никогда не верь, что этого достаточно.
RU.author: Роберт Хеллер

RU.text: Потеря - это не что иное, как изменение, а изменение - это наслаждение Природы.
RU.author: Марк Аврелий

RU.text: Кто-то особенный, только если ты ему скажешь.
RU.author: Байрон Пульсифер

RU.text: Сегодня - это то завтра, о котором ты беспокоился вчера.
Нет пути к счастью, счастье - это путь.
RU.author: Тич Нат Хан

RU.text: День всегда выглядит ярче из-за улыбки.
Спотыкание может предотвратить падение.
Тот, кто больше говорит, быстрее выдыхается.
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: Тот, кто доволен, богат.
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: То, чего мы достигнем внутренне, изменит внешнюю реальность.
RU.author: Плутарх

RU.text: Наша сила вырастает из наших слабостей.
RU.author: Ральф Уолдо Эмерсон

RU.text: Мы должны стать теми переменами, которые хотим видеть.
RU.author: Махатма Ганди

RU.text: Счастье обретается в действии, а не просто в обладании.
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Отдайте свое будущее в надежные руки сами.
Мы выбираем свою судьбу по тому, как относимся к другим.
RU.author: Остроумие

RU.text: Ни одна снежинка в лавине никогда не чувствует себя ответственной.
RU.author: Вольтер

RU.text: Удача благоволит храбрым.
RU.author: Вергилий

RU.text: Я верю только в одно - в силу человеческой воли.
RU.author: Иосиф Сталин

RU.text: Лучший выход - это всегда пройти до конца.
RU.author: Роберт Фрост

RU.text: Ум с трудом отучается от того, чему он давно научился.
RU.author: Сенека

RU.text: Я уничтожаю своих врагов, когда делаю их своими друзьями.
RU.author: Авраам Линкольн

RU.text: Ни один сад не обходится без сорняков.
RU.author: Томас Фуллер

RU.text: Нет неудачи, кроме как в том, чтобы больше не пытаться.
RU.author: Элберт Хаббард

RU.text: Добрые слова откроют железную дверь.
RU.author: Турецкая пословица

RU.text: Проблемы - это всего лишь возможности с шипами на них.
RU.author: Хью Миллер

RU.text: Жизнь - это всего лишь шанс вырастить душу.
RU.author: А. Пауэлл Дэвис

RU.text: Горы можно преодолеть только по извилистым тропинкам.
RU.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

RU.text: Пусть сад пробуждения наших сердец расцветет сотнями цветов.
RU.author: Тич Нат Хан

RU.text: Фортуна дружит со смелыми.
RU.author: Джон Драйден

RU.text: Оставайся верным мечтам своей юности.
RU.author: Friedrich von Schiller

RU.text: Ты никогда не будешь неудачником, пока не перестанешь пытаться.
RU.author: Майк Дитка

RU.text: Наука - это организованное знание. Мудрость - это организованная жизнь.
RU.author: Иммануил Кант

RU.text: Знать недостаточно; мы должны применять!
RU.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

RU.text: Сильные убеждения завоевывают сильных людей, а затем делают их сильнее.
RU.author: Ричард Бах

RU.text: Осень - это вторая весна, когда каждый лист - это цветок.
RU.author: Альбер Камю

RU.text: Если ты отдашься ветру, ты сможешь оседлать его.
RU.author: Тони Моррисон

RU.text: Держись подальше от солнечного света, и ты не сможешь увидеть тень.
RU.author: Хелен Келлер

RU.text: Запишите свои планы карандашом и дайте Богу ластик.
RU.author: Пауло Коэльо

RU.text: Вдохновение существует, но оно должно застать нас за работой.
RU.author: Пабло Пикассо

RU.text: Выбирайте сражения, достаточно масштабные, чтобы иметь значение, и достаточно мелкие, чтобы победить.
RU.author: Джонатан Козол

RU.text: Не компрометируйте себя. Ты - это все, что у тебя есть.
RU.author: Дженис Джоплин

RU.text: Короткое изречение часто содержит много мудрости.
RU.author: Софокл

RU.text: Трудности - это вещи, которые показывают человеку, каковы они есть.
RU.author: Эпиктет

RU.text: Когда ты сомневаешься в своей силе, ты придаешь силу своему сомнению.
RU.author: Оноре де Бальзак

RU.text: Причина скрыта. Эффект виден всем.
RU.author: Овидий

RU.text: Благоразумный вопрос - это половина мудрости.
RU.author: Фрэнсис Бэкон

RU.text: Путь к успеху заключается в масштабных, решительных действиях.
RU.author: Тони Роббинс

RU.text: Я позволяю своей интуиции вести меня по моему пути.
RU.author: Мануэль Пуч

RU.text: Природа забирает любую способность, которая не используется.
RU.author: Уильям Р. Инге

RU.text: Если ты хочешь стать писателем, пиши.
RU.author: Эпиктет

RU.text: Нет пути к процветанию, процветание - это путь.
RU.author: Уэйн Дайер

RU.text: Либо ты управляешь днем, либо день управляет тобой.
RU.author: Джим Рон

RU.text: Лучше быть невеждой в каком-то вопросе, чем наполовину знать его.
RU.author: Публилий Сирус

RU.text: Следуй своим инстинктам. Вот где проявляется истинная мудрость.
RU.author: Опра Уинфри

RU.text: Никогда не было хорошего ножа, сделанного из плохой стали.
RU.author: Бенджамин Франклин

RU.text: Чтобы совершить великие дела, мы должны не только действовать, но и мечтать.
RU.author: Анатоль Франс

RU.text: Терпение - спутник мудрости.
RU.author: Святой Августин

RU.text: Ум - это все. Тем, кем ты думаешь, ты становишься.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Чтобы наслаждаться жизнью, мы должны ко многому прикасаться легкомысленно.
RU.author: Вольтер

RU.text: Чтобы летать, мы должны иметь сопротивление.
RU.author: Майя Лин

RU.text: То, что вы видите, зависит от того, что вы ищете.
У сердца есть свои причины, о которых разум не знает.
RU.author: Блез Паскаль

RU.text: Будь великим в действии, каким ты был в мыслях.
RU.author: Уильям Шекспир

RU.text: Воображение правит миром.
RU.author: Наполеон Бонапарт

RU.text: Добрые слова стоят недешево. И все же они многого добиваются.
RU.author: Блез Паскаль

RU.text: Нет большего вреда, чем потраченное впустую время.
RU.author: Микеланджело

RU.text: Интуиция подскажет думающему уму, куда смотреть дальше.
RU.author: Джонас Солк

RU.text: Беспокойство бросает на мелочь большую тень.
Страхи - это не что иное, как состояние ума.
RU.author: Наполеон Хилл

RU.text: Путешествие в тысячу миль начинается с одного шага.
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: Эффективность - это делать все правильно; эффективность - это делать правильные вещи.
RU.author: Питер Друкер

RU.text: Пылай огнем, который никогда не погаснет.
RU.author: Луиза Сигеа

RU.text: Не плачь, потому что все кончено. Улыбнись, потому что это случилось.
RU.author: Доктор Сьюз

RU.text: Легче сделать 'Нет'. Легче сказать 'Да'.
RU.author: Джейсон Фрид

RU.text: Быть неправым - это ничто, если вы не продолжаете помнить об этом.
RU.author: Конфуций

RU.text: Вчерашние хоум-раны не выигрывают сегодняшние игры.
RU.author: Бейб Рут

RU.text: Молчание глубоко, как Вечность, Речь мелка, как Время.
RU.author: Карлайл

RU.text: Не душите друг друга. Никто не может расти в тени.
RU.author: Лео Ф. Бускалья

RU.text: Муравей в движении делает больше, чем дремлющий бык
RU.author: Лао-цзы

RU.text: Вы не можете пожать руку со сжатым кулаком.
RU.author: Индира Ганди

RU.text: Правильное решение основано на знаниях, а не на цифрах.
RU.author: Платон

RU.text: Осторожные редко ошибаются.
RU.author: Конфуций

RU.text: Если нет борьбы, то нет и прогресса.
RU.author: Фредерик Дуглас

RU.text: Там, где есть великая любовь, всегда есть чудеса.
RU.author: Уилла Кэтер

RU.text: Время, которое вам нравится тратить впустую, не было потрачено впустую.
RU.author: Джон Леннон

RU.text: Каждая проблема имеет в своих руках подарок для вас.
RU.author: Ричард Бах

RU.text: Печаль улетает на крыльях времени.
RU.author: Jean de la Fontaine

RU.text: Я часто сожалел о своей речи, но никогда о своем молчании.
RU.author: Публилий Сирус

RU.text: Никогда не откладывай на завтра то, что ты можешь сделать сегодня.
RU.author: Томас Джефферсон

RU.text: Разум подобен парашютам. Они функционируют только тогда, когда открыты .
RU.author: Томас Дьюар

RU.text: Если человек делает все, что в его силах, что еще остается?
RU.author: Джордж Паттон

RU.text: Секрет успеха - в постоянстве в достижении цели.
RU.author: Бенджамин Дизраэли

RU.text: Жизнь - это прогресс, а не остановка.
RU.author: Ральф Эмерсон

RU.text: Все времена года прекрасны для того, кто несет в себе счастье.
RU.author: Гораций Фрисс

RU.text: Чтобы избежать критики, ничего не делай, ничего не говори, будь никем.
RU.author: Элберт Хаббард

RU.text: Все меняется, ничто не исчезает.
RU.author: Овидий

RU.text: Отсутствие делает сердце более любящим.
RU.author: Хейнс Бейли

RU.text: Воображение - это самый высокий воздушный змей, которого только можно запустить.
RU.author: Лорен Бэколл

RU.text: Начало знания - это открытие чего-то, чего мы не понимаем.
RU.author: Фрэнк Герберт

RU.text: Любовь не заставляет мир вращаться, любовь - это то, что делает поездку стоящей.
RU.author: Элизабет Браунинг

RU.text: Всякий раз, когда вы устраняете невозможное, все, что остается, каким бы невероятным оно ни было, должно быть правдой.
RU.author: Артур Конан Дойл

RU.text: Хорошая древесина не растет легко; чем сильнее ветер, тем крепче деревья.
RU.author: Дж. Уиллард Марриотт

RU.text: Я верю, что мы в корне одинаковы и обладаем одинаковым базовым потенциалом.
RU.author: Далай-лама

RU.text: Ветер и волны всегда на стороне самых умелых мореплавателей.
RU.author: Эдвард Гиббон

RU.text: Будущее принадлежит тем, кто верит в красоту своей мечты.
RU.author: Элеонора Рузвельт

RU.text: Чтобы получить то, чего у тебя никогда не было, ты должен сделать то, чего никогда не делал.
Будьте благодарны, когда вы чего-то не знаете, потому что это дает вам возможность учиться.
Сила не зависит от физических возможностей. Это происходит от неукротимой воли.
RU.author: Махатма Ганди

RU.text: Каждое несчастье, с которым вы столкнетесь, будет нести в себе семя завтрашней удачи.
RU.author: О.Г. Мандино

RU.text: Простить - значит освободить заключенного и осознать, что этим заключенным был ты.
RU.author: Льюис Б. Смидес

RU.text: В разделенности кроется величайшее несчастье мира, в сострадании - истинная сила мира.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Страстно веря во что-то, чего еще не существует, мы создаем это.
RU.author: Никос Казандзакис

RU.text: Отпускание - это не конец света, это начало новой жизни.
Все великие исполнители, с которыми я работал, движимы личной мечтой.
RU.author: Джон Элиот

RU.text: Одно из преимуществ беспорядка в том, что человек постоянно совершает захватывающие открытия.
RU.author: А. А. Милн

RU.text: Я никогда не вижу того, что было сделано; я вижу только то, что еще предстоит сделать.
RU.author: Мария Кюри

RU.text: Немедленно начинайте жить и считать каждый отдельный день отдельной жизнью.
RU.author: Сенека

RU.text: Если вы не знаете, куда направляетесь, то, скорее всего, окажетесь где-нибудь в другом месте.
RU.author: Лоуренс Питер

RU.text: Не так важно знать все, как ценить то, что мы узнаем.
RU.author: Ханна Мор

RU.text: Райская птица садится только на руку, которая не цепляется.
RU.author: Джон Берри

RU.text: Думай как мудрец, но общайся на языке народа.
RU.author: Уильям Йейтс

RU.text: Ради всего святого, практикуйтесь в мелочах, а затем переходите к большему.
RU.author: Эпиктет

RU.text: Если человек не знает, в какой порт плывет, то никакого попутного ветра не будет.
RU.author: Сенека

RU.text: Наша величайшая слава не в том, что мы никогда не падаем, а в том, что мы поднимаемся каждый раз, когда падаем.
Быть правым - это сильно переоцененная ценность. Даже остановившиеся часы показывают правильное время дважды в день.
Расстраиваться из-за того, чего у тебя нет, значит тратить впустую то, что у тебя есть.
RU.author: Кен С. Кейс

RU.text: Если бы мы делали то, на что способны, мы бы поразили самих себя.
RU.author: Томас Эдисон

RU.text: В жизни ничего не нужно бояться. Это нужно только понять.
RU.author: Мария Кюри

RU.text: Успешные люди задают лучшие вопросы и, как следствие, получают лучшие ответы.
RU.author: Тони Роббинс

RU.text: Любовь не слепа; она просто позволяет человеку видеть то, чего не видят другие.
Жизнь - это процесс. Мы - это процесс. Вселенная - это процесс.
RU.author: Энн Шефф

RU.text: Я думаю, что каким-то образом мы узнаем, кто мы есть на самом деле, а затем живем с этим решением.
RU.author: Элеонора Рузвельт

RU.text: Мы узнаем о том, что мы сказали, от тех, кто слушает наши речи.
RU.author: Кеннет Паттон

RU.text: Небольшое знание, которое действует, стоит бесконечно больше, чем много знаний, которые бездействуют.
RU.author: Халиль Джебран

RU.text: Если ты встанешь еще раз, чем упадешь, ты справишься.
Двери, которые мы открываем и закрываем каждый день, определяют нашу жизнь.
RU.author: Флора Уиттмор

RU.text: Худший банкрот в мире - это человек, потерявший свой энтузиазм.
RU.author: Х. В. Арнольд

RU.text: Счастье приходит, когда ваша работа и слова приносят пользу вам и другим.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Не сосредотачивайтесь на принятии правильного решения, сосредоточьтесь на том, чтобы сделать это решение правильным.
Во вселенной все совершенно, даже ваше желание улучшить ее.
RU.author: Уэйн Дайер

RU.text: Вселенная полна волшебных вещей, терпеливо ожидающих, когда наш ум станет острее.
RU.author: Иден Филпоттс

RU.text: Точно так же, как свеча не может гореть без огня, люди не могут жить без духовной жизни.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: То, чего долго ждали, принимает форму неожиданного, когда, наконец, оно приходит.
RU.author: Марк Твен

RU.text: Действие не всегда может принести счастье, но нет счастья без действия.
RU.author: Бенджамин Дизраэли

RU.text: Я не верю в неудачу. Это не неудача, если вам понравился процесс .
RU.author: Опра Уинфри

RU.text: То, чего ты не хочешь, чтобы делали с тобой, не делай с другими.
RU.author: Конфуций

RU.text: Короткие слова лучше всего, а старые слова, когда они короткие, лучше всего.
RU.author: Уинстон Черчилль

RU.text: Если ты зажжешь для кого-нибудь лампу, это также осветит твой путь.
RU.author: Будда

RU.text: Я сделал все, что мог: это, пожалуй, вся философия жизни, которая нужна человеку.
RU.author: Линь-ютан

RU.text: Благодаря настойчивости многие люди добиваются успеха в том, что, казалось, обречено на неминуемый провал.
RU.author: Бенджамин Дизраэли

RU.text: Благодарите за дождь жизни, который толкает нас к новым горизонтам.
RU.author: Байрон Пульсифер
